glsa.title: Lynx: Arbitrary command execution
glsa.synopsis: Lynx is vulnerable to an issue which allows the remote execution of arbitrary commands.

background.p: Lynx is a fully-featured WWW client for users running cursor-addressable, character-cell display devices such as vt100 terminals and terminal emulators.

description.p: iDefense labs discovered a problem within the feature to execute local cgi-bin programs via the "lynxcgi:" URI handler. Due to a configuration error, the default settings allow websites to specify commands to run as the user running Lynx.

impact.p: A remote attacker can entice a user to access a malicious HTTP server, causing Lynx to execute arbitrary commands.
